title: PRIVACY_ACT_PRIVILEGE_AND_PROFESSIONAL_SECRECY
all_text: Privilege and Professional SecrecyProtected information — solicitors, advocates andnotaries 27 The head of a government institution may refuse todisclose any personal information requested under subsection 12(1) that is subject to solicitor-client privilege orthe professional secrecy of advocates and notaries or tolitigation privilege. R.S., 1985, c. P-21, s. 27; 2019, c. 18, s. 49. Protected information — patents and trademarksThe head of a government institution may refuse to 27.1 disclose any personal information requested under subsection 12(1) that is subject to the privilege set out in section 16.1 of the Patent Act or section 51.13 of the Trademarks Act. 2018, c. 27, s. 274; 2014, c. 20, s. 366(E).
